info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Columbia, central Richmond, south central Edgefield and west central Aiken Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Augusta Regional Airport, or near Augusta, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Evans, Martinez, Augusta, Belvedere, Clearwater, Hephzibah, Glendale, South Augusta, Midtown, Summerville, Augusta Mall, Daniel Field, Augusta Regional Airport, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Augusta National Golf Club, West End Augusta, New Savannah Bluff Lock & Dam Park, Poverty Hill and Glenn Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 193 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 5. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
